title: A fabulous experience
text: We were treated to a truly special evening of food and wine at The Lyle. Great atmosphere and what a change from how it was. All the staff were professional, attentive and engaging and it was truly the best food we've had in a long time. We'll be returning as soon as we can.

title: Great lunch with friends in a COVID safe environment
text:
Having booked well in advance we had the nervous among us taking their first trip out since March. The staff clearly explained their one way system, all diners are outside under the new gazebo and all the staff wore face masks or visors. Our lunch was a pleasure from beginning to end. All the waiting staff were friendly, professional and attentive, with a good dose of humour thrown in, every one went to extra lengths to make our lunch a great experience.
The food and wine were all great and the menu is less restricted that some more recently opened restaurants. I have no hesitation in recommending.

title: Jail breaking fun
text: What a fantastic time, lots of clue cracking to do, there were 6 of us, everyone enjoyed it and played their part. We were all escape room first timers and will be recommending to others and coming back again next year. Added bonus to get to eat at The Shuffle House afterwards to dissect the previous hour's entertainment.

title: Iconic place
text: It was a great place to see, went early as found out you can run there, sadly not on the track but around the top. Unfortunately the building is looking a bit neglected in places but still worth a visit.

title: Clever sympathetic restoration.
text: The restoration of the Parthenon is almost complete, it's breathtaking in its size and dominance. The restoration is great, they have chosen to only restore to the height of any original pieces left, a clever idea and makes you understand and appreciate its history more.

title: A guided tour is essential
text: Obviously the top place to visit in Athens but to appreciate it a guided tour is essential as are sensible shoes and a bottle of water. Lovely to see the sun setting over it.

title: What a museum!
text: This is a must, great museum and architecturally amazing, there are glass floors and wide easy routes around. Recently opened ruins beneath which demonstrate again how fantastic the design is.

title: Great location, helpful staff, rooftop bar and restaurant
text:
This hotel is well located as an easy walk to many attractions. The breakfast was great and the staff really friendly and efficient, they were always happy to seat our group together. Reception staff were helpful too. Room was neat and shower room was small but all working well. Lighting in the room could have been better but that's a minor point.
The view of the Acropolis from the roof was fabulous.

title: Wine tour, tasting and lunch
text: We had booked a wine tour and tasting and were fortunate that the timing allowed us to stay and have lunch in this fantastic restaurant. The wine tour was informative and the tasting of 4 wines was well tutored and informed - the 2014 Nerello Mascalese from Etna was my star of the show. Our host was exceptional and it was particularly helpful to me as I'm a WSET student. The food was superb and all set in a stunning location overlooking some to Gulfi's vineyards where the harvest was in full swing.

title: Great place
text: This place is very popular and for good reason, great food, great service. Don't miss out, it's worth a visit and a short wait for a table. ...

title: WSET Level 3
text: I recently completed WSET Level 3, I gained an incredible amount of in depth knowledge thanks to Victoria and Jonny's teaching along with a great group of fellow wine enthusiasts. I'll definitely be back again soon for some further tastings.

title: Make your own gin.... yes please!
text: A fun experience making our own gin - which tastes great. the gin cocktails we had during the time were delicious. An interesting way to spend a few hours and great that you get to understand the whole process. I liked wax sealing the bottles.

title: Consistently great place to eat.
text: Great food and lovely atmosphere, there are always a variety of specials in addition to the usual menu and it's consistently excellent whatever you chose. guaranteed a warm welcome too. it's small and cosy so booking is a good idea.

title: 4 week wine comparison
text: 4 Tuesday evenings well spent comparing Old and New world wines with a great group of people and the extremely knowledgeable Victoria. Plenty learnt and some different wine choices will ensue with my new knowledge. I'll be booking more in next year.

title: A lovely surprise find
text:
After a visit to Petworh enroute to the New Forest we were looking for place to stop for lunch. We're very glad we stopped here, service great and the food was amazing. The toilets were spotless too - a particular point in their favour as this is so often what let's a restaurant down.
We're already wondering about coming back for a stay.

title: Climbing the 02 for the view
text: This was good fun and staff were efficient and friendly, our guide Liam was helpful to everyone in our group. It was a rainy, windy cold day which was a shame as the views would have been better in the sun. I suggest wearing gloves particularly when it's cold and wet as you have to hold the metal safety latch that that attaches you to the safety system.

title: Consistently poor service
text: The Royal Wells is in a great location which should make it the perfect place for meeting with friends and family coming to visit our home town. unfortunately the service is consistently poor, staff are never trained and as other reviewers have said they often don't seem to want to be there. On my most recent visit staff seemed to vanish leaving just the newest member of staff (he'd started that day) to try and cope with an increasingly busy bar, I went to find some help for him to discover even the reception desk unstaffed with a notice directing people to seek help from the bar staff!

title: a hidden gem with great food and wine
text: Book ahead - we didn't and were very lucky to get a table. The waiter warmed to us and we enjoyed discussing their excellent wine list. The food was superb and we enjoyed every course. fantastic value too, definitely recommended.

title: amazing pizza
text: The pizza here is fantastic, it took us 3 attempts to get a table so book ahead. The staff were great at explaining all the different types of pizza and the ingredients in everything were top quality.

title: Tour of Pompeii
text: We booked a 5 hour guided tour of Pompeii with Rosa. It was fantastic she was engaging and did a brilliant job of explaining the history of the site to us. Her English was excellent, highly recommend this tour and it's good to have long enough to get a true sense of it all.
place: Loretta's Pompeii and Amalfi Coast Tours

title: Well located hotel
text:
We booked a 3 night long weekend, the hotel is in a great central location although like others we found this quite noisy from the student bars nearby which saw people spilling onto the street at all hours.
Having only one small lift and no option to use stairs was irritating particularly as we were a group of 8 and we had to wait for everyone each time we were either coming back or going out.
The room seemed recently decorated although we couldnt use the drawers. The bathroom had some plumbing issues with a leaking sink, a loose toilet seat (which got taken away, refitted and then replaced) and a lack of water pressure for the shower.
Staff were friendly although oddly wanted to discourage us from a restaurant reservation we'd made even offering to cancel it for us.... We went and it was great.
Overall the location was the best point for this hotel being in the centre of the old district with plenty nearby to walk to.

title: Fantastic hotel in great location
text: This is a wonderful family run hotel the staff are all friendly and efficient the food is top class and it's really well located just a short walk from the lifts. They look after children brilliantly and although ours are now grown up we all still love it.This was our second stay and we will definitely be returning again.

title: Fascinating!
text: Well worth the effort to visit but I'm not sure that the title of ice palace gives an idea of what to expect. This glacier is unique and it's quite mind blowing to be walking around inside it and take a trip on a boat! Don't attempt it in ski boots and take your crash helmet as it's better than having to wear one they supply.

title: Great mountain restaurant
text: You have to ski to the Spannagelhaus but it's worth the small effort to get there. Recently refurbished and with friendly efficient staff. The menu is good value and very tasty and service is very quick. The toilets are even on the same level as the restaurant so no struggling up and down stairs in ski boots. Visit the caves too, the entrance is right next to it.
